txt.en: So it seems that the shadowy fingers of Angmar have stretched even into desolate Forochel, sewing the seeds of conflict here as in all places they touch.\n\nHere at least, it seems that their preparations are less ready than elsewhere, or perhaps they find little of value, for they rely mostly on their less trustworthy allies -- the Dourhands and the savage Gauredain -- rather than their well-ordered hordes of Orcs and evil Men.

It seems that the Angmarim have sent little more than a small expeditionary force into Forochel as yet. Perhaps they are content to focus on the greater battles in the North Downs? Or maybe there is some limit to the force they can yet marshal against the North. In either case, you are doing your best to whittle those forces down.
